name: rebaptism
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a Christian ceremony involving water in which someone officially becomes a member of a Christian Church again or returns to strong religious feelings: The Catholic Church does not usually require rebaptism of converts from other Christian churches. They objected to the thousands of re-baptisms that were taking place.
More examplesFewer examplesShe recently returned to her faith, even being dipped in a local river in a re-baptism ceremony.They demanded rebaptism for all those who came to them from other churches.The practice of adult rebaptism is a key requirement of some Christian denominations.
